title: [GAMEPLAY]  Clicking Delays - What mouse are you using?
body:
So it's no secret that, with the new patch, many people are having clicking delays with their mouse and sometimes keyboard.  I've noticed that some people fixed the issue by switching to a different mouse.  I'm using a Razer Orochi, and the delays start happening around 10 minutes into each game.  One person was having issues with his Orochi as well, but fixed it by swapping to something else.

This issue is extremely frustrating for all affected, but whining about Rito won't do any good.  

If you're getting this issue, please post what mouse (and/or keyboard) you're using, and if you have other mice, tell us which ones work properly!  The info might be useful for Riot, helping them push out a fix faster.

replies.body: $5 mouse/keyboard from walmart. Haven't experienced lag. GG.

Razer DeathAdder Model # RZ01-0015
and my keyboard is a Razer BlackWidow Tournament Edition Model #RZ03-0081

Had to switch over to my old Logitech mouse and it seems okay at the moment... but just okay... hard to go back... :(

PLEASE UP VOTE THIS THREAD IF YOU ARE LISTING YOUR MOUSE/KEYBOARD!
I got a razer orochi, but for some reason I find using a trackpad easier anyway so I use that instead regardless. Well, this bug doesn't effect track pads I guess.

Logitech G600

Changing my DPI does not change the lag.

Armageddon Aquila X2. It's a Asian gaming mouse I assume(I live in Asia and there isn't much evidence of this brand existing on the internet so I'll assume so) Keyboard is an Apple Wireless Keyboard from an iMac ^^

G500s.
I'm used to lag at this point so it barely affects me, unless I'm playing a marksman.

My mouse is a Logitech G700 and seems to be working fine, but my keyboard...  Ugh.  It's a Logitech G710+, and I love the thing, but with this last patch I've been seeing the delay everyone is talking about here.  It's really annoying.

Logitech G500s. Clicks aren't registering every 10-15 clicks. Got it down to a science. Trying to play around it, but dang. Being a person who relies on mechanics, it really....Puts a damper on my performance. Keyboard is working fine though. Logitech G710+.
The thing is I don't even know what brand of mouse I am using lol.

I'm on a 10 dollar Logitech M100.  Zero problems for me except East Coast Ping spikes.

Built in Lenovo T440s Keyboard.

Logitech G700s mouse, no delay
Built in Steel Series keyboard on laptop, delay. Freaked when it first happened cause I couldn't {{summoner:11}}
Logitech G700s, built-in KB on laptop. Rito finally acknowledged the problem, so cross your fingers for a hotfix.
